div.p: RB MSS M1, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

I write this long after midnight, dear Miss Lewellin, so is my time beset; but I want to answer your kind letter
Letter not found. at once, to thank the Lady,
Not identified. who so kindly offers the Gardeners Chronicle. I receive it however regularly by the mail, and did so since about 40 years. More, — I was befriended since the middle of the Century with the founder of the Gard. Chronicle Prof Lindley, who was illustrious before I was born, who conducted the Chronicle for 30 years as Proprietor and Editor, wo
who? wrote me on his last sickbed a letter, which was finished by his son Sir Nathaniel Lindley. The successor in the Editorship is since 30 years Dr Masters, a medical man and like myself a corr. Member of the Inst. of France. With best greeting to all of you

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: The annual Examinations, which I conducted as an hon. Officer for the government has as an extrawork commenced and go on all January.
